item.title: Red Dead Redemption Coming To Netflix
item.content:encoded:
Red Dead Redemption is set to release for Android and iOS through Netflix on December 4, 2025.

The original Red Dead Redemption has already been in the news today, with an ESRB rating appearing for current-gen consoles, including the PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and Nintendo Switch. Now, it seems that, along with these platforms, a mobile port will also be arriving for RDR.

Red Dead Redemption is Coming to Android and iOS Devices in December 2025

The iOS App Store and Google Play Store pages for Red Dead Redemption have already been made available online. The page clearly states that a Netflix membership will be required to play Red Dead Redemption on these devices. On iOS devices, the game will occupy approximately 3.1GB of storage space. To run the game, players must be running iOS 18.0 or later and iPadOS 18.0 or later. The title doesn’t include any multiplayer content.

Android and iOS device users will be able to get the complete Red Dead Redemption experience with this version, allowing them to not only experience the entire narrative where John Marston hunts a gang of criminals across the American West and Mexico, but also Undead Nightmare DLC content, where the game’s world is transformed into an “apocalyptic fight for survival against a zombie horde.”

In other news, Red Dead Redemption 2 has become the fourth best-selling game ever in terms of units sold. Additionally, more ‘enhanced version’ claims for RDR2 have surfaced online. item.title: Embark Studios Just Nerfed ARC Raiders’ Most OP Perk
item.content:encoded:
Embark Studios rolled out the 1.2.0 update for ARC Raiders today, introducing a new community-wide event, the dawn of a new map, and new ARC enemies to contend with. The team also issued several quality-of-life improvements, tweaks, and bug fixes. They also pushed out a silent adjustment to the Security Breach perk, nerfing the heck out of it.

In a move that some fans have questioned, the most OP perk in ARC Raiders has been dialled back. If you were pushing for Security Breach, you might want to now focus your attention elsewhere, as the perk isn’t as good as it was over the last two weeks.

Security Breach Nerf Explained

In a post on the ARC Raiders Discord server, the game’s community lead, Ossen, wrote:

We adjusted the security lockers because they were over-providing valuable items

The comment earned a string of emoji-based responses, the most popular of which was the clown emoji… Make of that what you will.

For most, this is a good move from Embark Studios, as it helps to tone down the overpowered perk that ‘chads’ were abusing to stack their stashes to the rafters with good equipment. It was also diluting the game’s experience, as the meta was to do night runs on maps like Buried City, soaking up loot routes and cracking open endless security lockers.

This change came in addition to some more positive ones, like the fact that desync has now been addressed, and you shouldn’t feel like you’ve been hit even though you dove behind cover. It also means that fighting ARC enemies will feel more accurate and reliable, not strangely disconnected and laggy.

The 1.2.0 update in ARC Raiders is live now on all platforms, and if you want to get access to the new map, you’ll need to work as a collective and provide enough resources to fuel the project.

Let me know on the Insider Gaming Discord server if you’re enjoying ARC Raiders.
